attributes.description: Nominal operating pressure for hydraulic routing to ensure consistent performance even under high dynamic load conditions.
attributes.name: nominalPressure

attributes.description: Flow capacity through the valve assembly, adjustable based on flight maneuver requirements.
attributes.name: flowCapacity

attributes.description: Type of hydraulic fluid used in the valve system, compatible with aerospace specifications and temperature variations.
attributes.name: hydraulicFluid

attributes.description: Actuation response time critical for ensuring rapid changes in control surface actuation during flight.
attributes.name: actuationResponseTime

attributes.description: Service interval definition to ensure reliability and preventive maintenance in high-cycle flight operations.
attributes.name: serviceInterval
attributes.value: 500 flight hours or per OEM guidelines

designScenario.description: The Directional Control Valves system is engineered to precisely manage the routing of hydraulic fluid between the central hydraulic pump and critical flight control assemblies. It integrates advanced electro-hydraulic actuation with real-time monitoring, ensuring rapid fluid redirection during maneuvering and emergency scenarios. The system encompasses automated and manual override capabilities, reinforcing safety with built-in redundancy and fail-safe modes.
designScenario.name: Directional Control Valves

details.description: The valve assembly shall regulate the hydraulic fluid flow between the pump and control actuators, enabling accurate directional changes of flight surfaces.
The system shall achieve fluid redirection within 0.4 seconds to meet rapid maneuver requirements during critical flight phases.
Redundant fail-safe mechanisms must be incorporated to automatically isolate the faulty valve segment and reroute fluid to maintain aircraft control.

The directional control valve system shall be built for high durability with integrated self-diagnostic features and low maintenance needs, ensuring sustained operational reliability during extended flight cycles.

relationships.description: The Directional Control Valves act as an intermediary in the hydraulic system, linking the Central Hydraulic Pump with the flight control Actuators.
The valves are compositionally integrated with advanced sensor arrays that provide real-time fluid pressure and temperature data for system monitoring.
Manual override components have a dependency on the electro-hydraulic actuators, supporting direct control during emergency conditions.

systemComponents.description: Primary assembly responsible for dynamically routing hydraulic fluid based on flight control commands, featuring both automated and manual control pathways.
systemComponents.name: Directional Control Valves Assembly

subComponents.description: Electro-hydraulic solenoid modules providing rapid switching of hydraulic paths in response to digital control signals.
subComponents.name: Electro-Hydraulic Solenoids

subComponents.description: Manual override units enabling direct pilot intervention for fluid control during system anomalies or maintenance scenarios.
subComponents.name: Manual Override Units

subComponents.description: In-line sensor arrays integrated within the valve housing to continuously monitor pressure and temperature, contributing to overall system diagnostics.
subComponents.name: In-line Sensor Arrays

systemComponents.description: Dedicated electronic control unit that processes sensor feedback and commands to adjust valve positions in real time.
systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Control Processor

systemComponents.description: Interface module which bridges pilot inputs with the valve actuation system, ensuring seamless manual and automated control transitions.
systemComponents.name: Pilot Interface Module

subComponents.description: Digital cockpit controls interfaced with the advanced control processor to issue rapid commands.
subComponents.name: Digital Control Panel
